input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Age has a direct effect on hospital costs and lip thickness. Hospital costs has a direct effect on lip thickness. The overall probability of high hospital bill is 37%. The probability of low hospital bill and thick lips is 23%. The probability of high hospital bill and thick lips is 25%. Is the chance of thick lips smaller when observing high hospital bill?
